adjective.description: Conducive to or characterized by the expression of love.
Of, characterized by, or suggestive of an idealized view of reality.
examples: a romantic attitude toward the past
some romantic dream of country peace

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting the artistic and literary movement of romanticism.

noun.description: A person with romantic beliefs or attitudes.
A writer or artist of the romantic movement.
examples: Wordsworth, Coleridge, and the later romantics

origin: Mid 17th century (referring to the characteristics of romance in a narrative): from archaic romaunt tale of chivalry, from an Old French variant of romanz (see romance).
